description: Incrementally largest terms in the continued fraction for Pi-2 (cf. A001203).
comments: No larger term in the first 10,672,905,501 terms of the c.f. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jul 18 2013
references: R. W. Gosper, Jr., Table of the simple continued fraction for pi and the derived decimal approximation, Math. Comp., 31 (1977), 1044.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
See A001203 for many additional references and links.
links: H. Havermann, Simple Continued Fraction for Pi [a 483 MB file containing 180 million terms]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pi Continued Fraction
Index entries for sequences related to the number Pi
crossrefs: Apart from initial term, same as A033089.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Corrected (missing a(9) added) by _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 08 2010
